body.p: Your Petitioner would most respectfully state that a judgement was rendered against him at the Spring Term of the Barren Circuit Court for the year Eighteen Hundred and Sixty One, for the Sum of Two Hundred Dollars on Bail Bond entered into by your Petitioner, for the appearance of one James White of Boyle County, Kentucky who was charged with stealing a shawl worth about Six Dollars. Your Petitioner Prays and will ever be greatful for the Remission of Said Amount as above specified

Your Obt Servt
B. A. Wheat
Nov 267, 1861
Refer you to Petn of White heretofore filed

Barren Cir. Ct
$200 } Bail Bond
Issd Decr 18. 1861
